page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA
page.content: The NW area comprises part of the town of Farnham with a supermarket, police station,railway station, sports centre,theatre, health centre etc. The population is concentrated in the NW corner spreading outwards through a lower density, prosperous, residential area with agricultural land to the east and wooded land to the south. After crossing the NW corner, the River Wey flows generally southwards through the eastern half. Farnham is within 1 hour of London by rail which makes it popular with commuters. A number of roads radiate from Farnham. The area is prosperous with low unemployment.Property prices are high which restricts movement into the area to the higher income levels. The number of non-white people living here is well below average. There are places of historic interest.
